metadata.title: Journal Pre-proof Algorithm for the classification of Covid-19 rashes

body_text.text: Up to a 20% of Covid-19 patients develop cutaneous manifestations such as 23 erythematous rash, rash with petechiae, vesicular rash, acral ischemia, livedo reticularis 24 and widespread urticaria 1,2 . The appropriate classification of these manifestations, 25 crucial for accurate scientific research, depends on physical exam and cannot be 26

correctly assessed with teledermatogy. In orther to make classification easier, our 27 suggestion is a simple algorithm which can be easily performed by patients, general 28 practitioners and intensive care unit professionals on the front lines confronting Covid-29 19 who are not used to dermatological examination ( fig. 1) . 30
When examining patients with generalized exanthem from Covid-19, the first step is to

FIGREF0.text: 32 look for the presence of vesicles or secondary erosions with crusts (fig. 2F). If absent, a 33 blanching component can be easily assessed by firmly pressing the affected area for 34 several seconds. Non-blanching generalized rashes composed of small red macules are 35 indicative of a rash with petechiae (fig. 2A). An acral distribution of non-blanching 36 violaceus lesions is indicative of acral ischemia (fig. 2B). A reticulated vascular pattern 37 orientates towards livedo reticularis subtype (fig. 2C). For blanching rashes, the next 38 step in our algorithm is to scratch the skin. Dermographism would manifest as linear 39 wheals at sites of scratching and orientate the diagnosis towards urticarial rash (fig. 2D) 40 while its absence orientates it towards erythematous rash (fig. 2E). A flashlight photo 41after each step may be taken immediately afterwards by the patient or medical staff so 42 that lesions can be easily assessed by means of teledermatology.

FIGREF1.text: Proposed Examples of Covid-associated rash with petechiae (A), acral ischemia (B), 52 livedo reticularis subtype located on the lower extremities (C), urticarial rash (D), 53 erythematous rash (E) and vesicular rash (F). Erythematous rash blanches on pressure 54 while rash with petechiae, livedo reticularis subtype or acral ischemia do not. Urticarial 55 rash may be associated with dermographism. Severe acute respiratory syndrome 56 coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection was confirmed in all the patients by reverse-57 transcriptase-polymerase-chain-reaction (RT-PCR) assay. 58
